title: Builder 'raped and strangled customer who complained then dumped body in bath'
text:

A builder is accused of tying up, raping and murdering his client in her own home after she complained to his bosses about his work.

Suzanne Fairman, 53, was found brutally slain in her own bathtub with the water still running on May 9.

Police in Richmond, Virginia, said builder Thomas E Clark, 59, has been indicted by a grand jury on charges of rape, murder and abduction with intent to defile.

According to reports, police had been called to Ms Fairman's home after relatives became worried when she didn't show up for a planned holiday.

Officers reportedly found a bloody steak knife on a nearby counter, along with a rubber glove and a wet bandanna with bloodsplatters.

(Image: CBS 6)

The contractor who had been carrying out works on her home has been accused of tying Fairman up, sexually assaulting her in her master bedroom then strangling her in her bathtub, the The Sun reports.

Authorities say Ms Fairman complained to Clark's supervisor about the work he had done on her deck and the quality of his labour.

It is alleged he then turned up on May 9, telling her he was there for finish the work.

After she allowed him into the property he is alleged to have tied her up, raped and murdered her.

A medical examiner found the Virginia Commonwealth University died of asphyxia.

(Image: CBS 6)

(Image: CBS 6)

Reports say Clark had previously served 15 years in jail for raping a woman in 1988.

In 2005 he pleaded guilty to attempted robbery after assaulting a woman inside her Richmond home and trying to extort money from her.

He served 10 years for that crime, and his electronic tag was removed just one week before Fairman was killed.

He has denied the crimes against Fairman.

He was already behind bars when police came to interview him about Fairman's death after authorities picked him up for failing to comply with his sex offender registry requirements.

According to the affidavit reported by US media, Clark allegedly described the victim as being in 'good shape,' and commented she was beaten up and thrown in the tub' despite officers making no mention at that stage of her having been beaten.

(Image: CBS 6)

(Image: CBS 6)

When Clark was confronted about that, he claimed he 'must have heard that from somewhere,' according to the affidavit.

Prosecutors in Virginia have not said whether they plan to seek the death penalty against Clark.

Fairman's son gave an emotional interview as her family was appealing for the public's help in identifying her killer in the wake of the grisly discovery.

Scott Fairman told media: "She was an incredible grandmother, she was a phenomenal mother. She would give even if she had nothing to give."
description: Thomas E Clark is accused of tying up Suzanne Fairman, 53, raping her then strangling her in her bathtub at her home in Richmond, Virginia
